abstract.para: How to create an ISO image file and a Boot-CD.

itemizedlist.listitem: At least one cd-r/cd-rw (cd-rw is recommended)

sect2.title: Directory structure
sect2.para: To create a Boot-CD all required components must be copied into a separate directory to write them onto the CD. At present, this root directory will be created in your local cvs root directory. For example, if you checked-out the reactos and freeldr modules to 'c:\cvs' the new root directoy will be 'c:\cvs\bootcd'. The directory layout looks like this:

para.literallayout: bootcd \- isoboot.bin \- disk \- bootdisk \- ... (bootdisk image files) \- loader \- fat.bin \- fat32.bin \- ... (more bootsector files) \- freeldr.sys \- setupldr.sys \- reactos \- txtsetup.sif \- atapi.sys \- blue.sys \- hal.dll \- ntoskrnl.exe \- ... (more drivers, dlls, etc.) \- system32 \- ntdll.dll \- smss.exe (renamed usetup.exe)

sect2.para: When you create the CD only the contents of the 'disk' directory will be copied to the CDs filesystem. So the directories 'bootdisk', 'loader' and 'reactos' will reside in the root directory of the CD. 'Isoboot.bin' will be the bootsector of the CD and will not be a visible part of the filesystem.

sect2.title: Creating the ISO image file
sect2.para: This description is based on the german edition of Nero 5.0. If you are using another edition, read the manual first.

sect3.title: 1 Build the bootsectors
sect3.para: Cd' to the bootsect directory in the freeldr module and run 'make'.

sect3.title: 2 Build the loaders
sect3.para: Cd' to the freeldr directory in the freeldr module and run 'make'.

FreeLoader (freeldr.sys) is a boot loader/manager that is used to load multiple operating system from a Harddisk. SetupLoader (setupldr.sys) is a modified FreeLoader which is used to boot ReactOS (notskrnl, hal and drivers) from the Boot-CD. It can not be used to load ReactOS from a Harddisk.

sect3.title: 3 Build ReactOS
sect3.para: Cd' to your reactos module and run 'make'.

sect3.title: 4 Create the iso image file
sect3.para: Run 'bootcd.bat' from the reactos directory. This creates the 'bootcd' directory tree and copies all required components into the directory tree. Finally, the ISO image file 'reactos.iso' is created in the 'bootcd' directory.

sect2.title: Creating the Boot-CD
sect2.para: Start your CD recording application and write the ISO image file 'reactos.iso' onto a CD-R or CD-RW.

sect2.title: Booting ReactOS from CD
sect2.para: I assume you already know how to boot your computer from a CD. If not, ask your local guru, seach the web or read the manual.
